meanings.definition: Sail or travel all the way around (something, especially the world).
meanings.sent1: The brave explorer was circumnavigating the globe in search of new lands.
meanings.sent2: The ship spent months circumnavigating the vast ocean, facing storms and challenges.
meanings.sent3: The sailor joked that he was so good at circumnavigating, he could even find his way out of a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a ship circumnavigating the globe, always coming back to the same starting point.
meanings.sent5: The idea of circumnavigating the world filled her with excitement and wonder.

meanings.definition: Travel around or circumvent (an obstacle or difficulty).
meanings.sent1: She was skilled at circumnavigating the busy city streets to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent2: The clever fox was adept at circumnavigating traps set by the farmers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was a master at circumnavigating the bird feeder to steal seeds.
meanings.sent4: He found a way to circumnavigate the bureaucratic red tape and get his project approved.
meanings.sent5: Her quick thinking allowed her to circumnavigate the problem and find a solution in no time.
